title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" and pertains to conveyance vessels. The Secretary of Transportation has the authority to convey two vessels to a nonprofit organization that operates and maintains a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial to merchant mariners. The vessels must be in the National Defense Reserve Fleet, at least 4,000 displacement tons, have no usefulness to the Government, and scheduled to be scrapped. The Secretary of Transportation can convey vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to a nonprofit organization that maintains a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial. The vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. The organization must agree to sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship. The organization must sell the vessel for scrap, use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial, and return any unused funds to the United States. The organization must sell the vessel for scrap, refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial with the proceeds, and return any unused funds to the United States. Amounts returned will be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. Vessels conveyed will be delivered at their location on the date of approval. The Secretary shall deliver each vessel conveyed under this section at its location on the date of approval, in its current condition, and at no cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels, including ABORIGINAL, AFTERSAIL, ALEXANDRIA, AMANDA, ARBITRAGE II, and ARIEL. Foreign-flag vessel H851, with official number 663823, is allowed to engage in coastwise trade for offshore drilling, despite restrictions under the Merchant Marine Act. Foreign-flag vessel H851, with official number 663823, may transport an offshore drilling platform jacket from Texas to Viosca Knoll 989, despite restrictions under the Merchant Marine Act. The Secretary of Transportation has the authority to issue certificates of documentation for this purpose. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsements, despite restrictions under the Merchant Marine Act. The Secretary of Transportation can issue a certificate of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for the vessel M/V TWIN DRILL if it undergoes a major conversion in a US shipyard costing more than 3 times its purchase value. The major conversion of a vessel in a US shipyard must cost more than 3 times its purchase value, be completed before June 30, 1995, and the vessel must be documented with a coastwise endorsement under chapter 121 of title 46, US Code. Additionally, the person documenting the vessel must contract with a US shipyard to construct another vessel of equal or greater capacity within 12 months of the enactment of this Act, for delivery within 36 months. The person documenting the vessel must contract with a US shipyard to construct an additional vessel of equal or greater capacity within 12 months of the enactment of this Act, for delivery within 36 months. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels REEL CLASS and DA WARRIOR with specific endorsements, bypassing certain sections of the United States Code.
